nano.remexp.net
Interface EventSocketListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
ClientConnection, FilteringPool, RemoteExperimentBroadcaster
public interface EventSocketListener

An interface that enables classes to act as event socket listeners and perform actions on events.

Version:
1.1 23.08.2012
Author:
Dominic Bosch

Method Summary
 void login(EventSocket sock, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pass)
          Used to login the client connection with a username and password.
 void performSocketEvent(EventSocket sock, java.lang.String msg)
          Takes actions if there is an incoming event on the socket.
 void removeEventSocket(EventSocket sock)
          After the socket hasn't reacted for a while it is removed.
 

Method Detail

performSocketEvent

void performSocketEvent(EventSocket sock,
                        java.lang.String msg)
Takes actions if there is an incoming event on the socket.

Parameters:
sock - The socket on which the event has been detected.
msg - The message that has been sent.

removeEventSocket

void removeEventSocket(EventSocket sock)
After the socket hasn't reacted for a while it is removed.

Parameters:
sock - The socket to be removed.

login

void login(EventSocket sock,
           java.lang.String user,
           java.lang.String pass)
Used to login the client connection with a username and password.

Parameters:
sock - The socket that tries to gain privileges.
user - The username used to gain privileges.
pass - The password passed as a MD-5 hash in case of a non-LiLa login, empty if LiLa login shall be attempted.
